group.description: Disable services that are not required for VDI\RDS virtual machines

entry.name: AllJoyn Router Service
entry.description: Routes AllJoyn messages for the local AllJoyn clients.

entry.name: Application Layer Gateway Service
entry.description: Provides support for 3rd party protocol plug-ins for Internet Connection Sharing.

entry.name: AVCTP service
entry.description: This is Audio Video Control Transport Protocol service

entry.name: BitLocker Drive Encryption Service
entry.description: BDESVC hosts the BitLocker Drive Encryption service. BitLocker Drive Encryption provides secure startup for the operating system, as well as full volume encryption for OS, fixed or removable volumes. This service allows BitLocker to prompt users for various actions related to their volumes when mounted, and unlocks volumes automatically without user interaction. Additionally, it stores recovery information to Active Directory, if available, and, if necessary, ensures the most recent recovery certificates are used.

entry.name: Block Level Backup Engine Service
entry.description: The WBENGINE service is used by Windows Backup to perform backup and recovery operations.

entry.name: Bluetooth Audio Gateway Service
entry.description: Service supporting the audio gateway role of the Bluetooth Handsfree Profile.

entry.name: Bluetooth Support Service
entry.description: The Bluetooth service supports discovery and association of remote Bluetooth devices.

entry.name: BranchCache
entry.description: This service caches network content from peers on the local subnet.

entry.name: Connected User Experiences and Telemetry
entry.description: The Connected User Experiences and Telemetry service enables features that support in-application and connected user experiences. Additionally, this service manages the event driven collection and transmission of diagnostic and usage information (used to improve the experience and quality of the Windows Platform) when the diagnostics and usage privacy option settings are enabled under Feedback and Diagnostics.

entry.name: Data Usage
entry.description: Network data usage, data limit, restrict background data, metered networks.

entry.name: Diagnostic Policy Service
entry.description: The Diagnostic Policy Service enables problem detection, troubleshooting and resolution for Windows components.

entry.name: Diagnostic Service Host
entry.description: The Diagnostic Service Host is used by the Diagnostic Policy Service to host diagnostics that need to run in a Local Service context.

entry.name: Diagnostic System Host
entry.description: The Diagnostic System Host is used by the Diagnostic Policy Service to host diagnostics that need to run in a Local System context.

entry.name: Encrypting File System (EFS)
entry.description: Provides the core file encryption technology used to store encrypted files on NTFS file system volumes.

entry.name: Fax
entry.description: Enables you to send and receive faxes, utilizing fax resources available on this computer or on the network.

entry.name: Function Discovery Provider Host
entry.description: The FDPHOST service hosts the Function Discovery (FD) network discovery providers. These FD providers supply network discovery services for the Simple Services Discovery Protocol (SSDP) and Web Services – Discovery (WS-D) protocol. Stopping or disabling the FDPHOST service will disable network discovery for these protocols when using FD. When this service is unavailable, network services using FD and relying on these discovery protocols will be unable to find network devices or resources.

entry.name: Function Discovery Resource Publication
entry.description: Publishes this computer and resources attached to this computer so they can be discovered over the network.

entry.name: Internet Connection Sharing (ICS)
entry.description: Provides network address translation, addressing, name resolution and/or intrusion prevention services for a home or small office network.

entry.name: Offline Files
entry.description: The Offline Files service performs maintenance activities on the Offline Files cache, responds to user logon and logoff events, implements the internals of the public API, and dispatches interesting events to those interested in Offline Files activities and changes in cache state.

entry.name: Optimize drives
entry.description: Helps the computer run more efficiently by optimizing files on storage drives.

entry.name: Parental Controls
entry.description: Enforces parental controls for child accounts in Windows. If this service is stopped or disabled, parental controls may not be enforced.

entry.name: Retail Demo Service
entry.description: The Retail Demo service controls device activity while the device is in retail demo mode.

entry.name: Sensor Monitoring Service
entry.description: Monitors various sensors in order to expose data and adapt to system and user state.

entry.name: Shell Hardware Detection
entry.description: Provides notifications for AutoPlay hardware events.

entry.name: SSDP Discovery
entry.description: Discovers networked devices and services that use the SSDP discovery protocol, such as UPnP devices. Also announces SSDP devices and services running on the local computer.

entry.name: UPnP Device Host
entry.description: Allows UPnP devices to be hosted on this computer.

entry.name: Volumetric Audio Compositor Service
entry.description: Hosts spatial analysis for Mixed Reality audio simulation.

entry.name: Windows Connect Now - Config Registrar
entry.description: WCNCSVC hosts the Windows Connect Now Configuration which is Microsoft's Implementation of Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) protocol. This is used to configure Wireless LAN settings for an Access Point (AP) or a Wi-Fi Device. The service is started programmatically as needed.

entry.name: Windows Media Player Network Sharing Service
entry.description: Shares Windows Media Player libraries to other networked players and media devices using Universal Plug and Play.

entry.name: Windows Mobile Hotspot Service
entry.description: Provides the ability to share a cellular data connection with another device. Recommended by Microsoft to disable: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/remote/remote-desktop-services/rds-vdi-recommendations

entry.name: Windows Update
entry.description: Enables the detection, download, and installation of updates for Windows and other programs.

entry.name: WLAN AutoConfig
entry.description: The WLANSVC service provides the logic required to configure, discover, connect to, and disconnect from a wireless local area network (WLAN) as defined by IEEE 802.11 standards. It also contains the logic to turn your computer into a software access point so that other devices or computers can connect to your computer wirelessly using a WLAN adapter that can support this.

entry.name: WWAN AutoConfig
entry.description: This service manages mobile broadband (GSM & CDMA) data card/embedded module adapters and connections by auto-configuring the networks. It is strongly recommended that this service be kept running for best user experience of mobile broadband devices.

entry.name: Xbox Accessory Management Service
entry.description: This service manages connected Xbox Accessories.

entry.name: Xbox Live Auth Manager
entry.description: Provides authentication and authorization services for interacting with Xbox Live.

entry.name: Xbox Live Game Save
entry.description: This service syncs save data for Xbox Live save enabled games.

entry.name: Xbox Live Networking Service
entry.description: This service supports the Windows.Networking.XboxLive application programming interface.

group.description: Remove Windows Universal Apps to speed up logons. DOES NOT SUPPORT ROLLBACK!

entry.description: Microsoft.BingWeather

entry.description: Microsoft.WindowsCamera

entry.name: Microsoft.WindowsFeedbackHub
entry.description: Microsoft.WindowsFeedbackHub

entry.name: Microsoft.WindowsMaps
entry.description: Microsoft.WindowsMaps

entry.name: Microsoft.WindowsSoundRecorder
entry.description: Microsoft.WindowsSoundRecorder

entry.name: Microsoft.WindowsStore
entry.description: Microsoft.WindowsStore

entry.name: Microsoft.Xbox.TCUI
entry.description: Microsoft.Xbox.TCUI

entry.name: Microsoft.XboxApp
entry.description: Microsoft.XboxApp

entry.name: Microsoft.XboxGameOverlay
entry.description: Microsoft.XboxGameOverlay

entry.name: Microsoft.XboxGamingOverlay
entry.description: Microsoft.XboxGamingOverlay

entry.name: Microsoft.XboxIdentityProvider
entry.description: Microsoft.XboxIdentityProvider

entry.name: Microsoft.XboxSpeechToTextOverlay
entry.description: Microsoft.XboxSpeechToTextOverlay

entry.name: Microsoft.ZuneMusic
entry.description: Microsoft.ZuneMusic

entry.name: Microsoft.ZuneVideo
entry.description: Microsoft.ZuneVideo

entry.name: Microsoft.MixedRealityPortal
entry.description: Provides access to mixed reality games and VR experiences.

entry.name: Microsoft.YourPhone
entry.description: Provides access to remotely send text messages or access images on Android-based phone.

group.description: Disable scheduled tasks that are not required for VDI\RDS virtual machines

entry.name: AnalyzeSystem
entry.description: This job analyzes the system looking for conditions that may cause high energy use.

entry.name: BfeOnServiceStartTypeChange
entry.description: Adjusts the start type for firewall-triggered services when the start type of the Base Filtering Engine (BFE) is disabled.

entry.name: Consolidator
entry.description: Collects and sends usage data to Microsoft if opted-in to the Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program.

entry.name: FamilySafetyMonitor
entry.description: Initializes Family Safety monitoring and enforcement.

entry.name: FamilySafetyRefresh
entry.description: Synchronizes the latest settings with the Microsoft family features service.

entry.name: File History (maintenance mode)
entry.description: Protects user files from accidental loss by copying them to a backup location when the system is unattended.

entry.name: Location Notifications
entry.description: Location Notifications

entry.name: Location Notifications 2
entry.description: Location Notifications 2

entry.name: MapsToastTask
entry.description: MapsToastTask

entry.name: MapsUpdateTask
entry.description: MapsUpdateTask

entry.name: Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser
entry.description: Aggregates and uploads Application Telemetry information if opted-in to the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program.

entry.name: Microsoft-Windows-DiskDiagnosticDataCollector
entry.description: Reports general disk and system information to Microsoft for users participating in the Customer Experience Program.

entry.name: Microsoft-Windows-DiskDiagnosticResolver
entry.description: Warns users about faults reported by hard disks that support the Self Monitoring and Reporting Technology (S.M.A.R.T.) standard. This task is triggered automatically by the Diagnostic Policy Service when a S.M.A.R.T. fault is detected.

entry.name: Mobile Broadband Accounts
entry.description: Mobile Broadband Accounts

entry.name: ProactiveScan
entry.description: NTFS volume health scan.

entry.name: ProcessMemoryDiagnosticEvents
entry.description: Schedules a memory diagnostic in response to system events.

entry.name: ProgramDataUpdater
entry.description: Collects program telemetry information if opted-in to the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program.

entry.name: Proxy
entry.description: Collects and uploads autochk SQM data if opted-in to the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program.

entry.name: RegIdleBackup
entry.description: Registry idle backup task.

entry.name: ResolutionHost
entry.description: The Windows Diagnostic Infrastructure Resolution host enables interactive resolutions for system problems detected by the Diagnostic Policy Service. It is triggered when necessary by the Diagnostic Policy Service in the appropriate user session. If the Diagnostic Policy Service is not running, the task will not run.

entry.name: RetailDemo-CleanupOfflineContent
entry.description: Retail Demo

entry.name: RunFullMemoryDiagnostic
entry.description: Detects and mitigates problems in physical memory (RAM).

entry.name: Scheduled
entry.description: Performs periodic maintenance of the computer system by fixing problems automatically or reporting them through the Action Center.

entry.name: ScheduledDefrag
entry.description: This task defragments the computers hard disk drives.

entry.name: SR
entry.description: This task creates regular system protection points.

entry.name: StartComponentCleanup
entry.description: This job clean up components automatically when the system is not in use. This task is known to cause excessive CPU usage.

entry.name: StartupAppTask
entry.description: Scans startup entries and raises notification to the user if there are too many startup entries.

entry.name: UsbCeip
entry.description: Collects Universal Serial Bus related statistics and information about your machine and sends to the Windows Device Connectivity engineering group at Microsoft, if opted-in to Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program.

entry.name: VerifyWinRE
entry.description: Validates the Windows Recovery Environment.

entry.name: Windows Defender Cache Maintenance
entry.description: Periodic maintenance task.

entry.name: Windows Defender Cleanup
entry.description: Periodic cleanup task.

entry.name: Windows Defender Scheduled Scan
entry.description: Periodic scan task.

entry.name: Windows Defender Verification
entry.description: Periodic verification task.

entry.name: Windows Error Reporting
entry.description: Windows Error Reporting task to process queued reports.

entry.name: Windows Media Sharing
entry.description: This task updates the cached list of folders and the security permissions on any new files in a user’s shared media library.

entry.name: WinSAT
entry.description: Measures a system’s performance and capabilities.

entry.name: XblGameSaveTask
entry.description: XblGameSave Standby Task

group.description: Various optimizations and tweaks for VDI\RDS virtual machines

entry.name: Disable background auto-layout
entry.description: Disabling background auto-layout can help improve EWF performance.

entry.name: Disable background disk defragmentation
entry.description: Disabling background disk defragmentation can help improve EWF performance.

entry.name: Disable default system screensaver
entry.description: Disable default system logon screensaver.

entry.name: Disable memory dump creation
entry.description: Disable memory dump creation.

entry.name: Disable NTFS last access timestamps
entry.description: If you are using NTFS, you can increase the performance of EWF by disabling the last access date/time stamps.

entry.name: Disable the Windows First Logon Animation
entry.description: Disable the Windows First Logon Animation.

entry.name: Hide hard error messages
entry.description: Disable system hard error messages.

entry.name: Increase Disk I/O Timeout to 200 seconds
entry.description: Increase Disk I/O Timeout to 200 seconds.

entry.name: Set power plan to High Performance
entry.description: Change current power plan to "High performance". If you rollback these changes, power plan will default to "Balanced".

entry.name: Native Image Generation 32bit (NGEN)
entry.description: THIS IS SLOW, it's normal for this operation to take a long time. This optimization pre-compiles .NET assemblies instead of using the just-in-time compilation using NGEN.exe. Does not support analyze/rollback modes, but it is generally safe to use.

entry.name: Native Image Generation 64bit (NGEN)
entry.description: THIS IS SLOW, it's normal for this operation to take a long time. This optimization pre-compiles .NET assemblies instead of using the just-in-time compilation using NGEN.exe. Does not support analyze/rollback modes, but it is generally safe to use.

group.description: Contains components that are often disabled for VDI\RDS machines, however can impact other applications or user experience. It is recommended to review these settings before applying them.

entry.name: Microsoft.StorePurchaseApp
entry.description: Microsoft Store application. Do not remove it if you're planning to use UWP applications.

entry.name: Microsoft.WindowsCalculator
entry.description: Built-in Windows Calculator. If your users are using it (mostly desktop sessions rather than published applications), do not remove it unless you have a replacement calculator app.

entry.name: Superfetch
entry.description: Maintains and improves system performance over time. If optimizing a persistent machine you may leave Superfetch enabled. If optimizing a non-persistent machine, disable it.

entry.name: Windows Error Reporting Service
entry.description: Allows errors to be reported when programs stop working or responding and allows existing solutions to be delivered. Also allows logs to be generated for diagnostic and repair services. Disable it if logs are not being gathered and analyzed.

entry.name: Windows Search
entry.description: Provides content indexing, property caching, and search results for files, e-mail, and other content. Consider disabling it as it has a high impact on server density.
